docs.snippet: New York Attorney General Eric Schneiderman said on Tuesday he had opened an inquiry into the Donald J. Trump Foundation to ensure the Republican presidential nominee's charity was complying with state laws governing nonprofits....
docs.lead_paragraph: New York Attorney General Eric Schneiderman said on Tuesday he had opened an inquiry into the Donald J. Trump Foundation to ensure the Republican presidential nominee's charity was complying with state laws governing nonprofits.

headline.main: New York Attorney General Opens Probe of Trump Foundation
headline.print_headline: New York Attorney General Opens Probe of Trump Foundation

docs.snippet: Donald Trump knows he could stand to lose a few pounds but otherwise is in great health, campaign adviser Sarah Huckabee Sanders told MSNBC on Wednesday after the Republican presidential candidate filmed a TV segment about his well-being....
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump knows he could stand to lose a few pounds but otherwise is in great health, campaign adviser Sarah Huckabee Sanders told MSNBC on Wednesday after the Republican presidential candidate filmed a TV segment about his well-being.

headline.main: Trump Could Lose a Few Pounds, but Otherwise Healthy: Adviser
headline.print_headline: Trump Could Lose a Few Pounds, but Otherwise Healthy: Adviser

docs.snippet: In a trove of newly leaked emails, former Secretary of State Colin Powell calls Donald Trump "a national disgrace" and suggests his own Republican Party is "crashing and burning."...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a trove of newly leaked emails, former Secretary of State Colin Powell calls Donald Trump "a national disgrace" and suggests his own Republican Party is "crashing and burning."

headline.main: In Leaked Emails, Powell Calls Trump a 'National Disgrace'
headline.print_headline: In Leaked Emails, Powell Calls Trump a 'National Disgrace'

docs.snippet: Mormons Manuel and Claire Saldana say they normally identify with Republican values and principles, but the Virginia couple is struggling to stay on board with the GOP after Donald Trump became the party's presidential nominee....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mormons Manuel and Claire Saldana say they normally identify with Republican values and principles, but the Virginia couple is struggling to stay on board with the GOP after Donald Trump became the party's presidential nominee.

headline.main: Republican Hold on Mormon Voters Slips With Trump as Nominee
headline.print_headline: Republican Hold on Mormon Voters Slips With Trump as Nominee

docs.snippet: The White House was submerged in scandal. Democrats faced tough midterm elections. And Hillary Clinton, far more popular than her embattled husband, had become a one-woman campaign machine....
docs.lead_paragraph: The White House was submerged in scandal. Democrats faced tough midterm elections. And Hillary Clinton, far more popular than her embattled husband, had become a one-woman campaign machine.

headline.main: Clinton Has History of Ignoring Health _ and Paying a Price
headline.print_headline: Clinton Has History of Ignoring Health _ and Paying a Price

docs.snippet: When Hillary Clinton was sidelined this week with pneumonia, her campaign didn't rush to cancel a busy slate of events out West. The presidential candidate's husband simply stepped in to take her place....
docs.lead_paragraph: When Hillary Clinton was sidelined this week with pneumonia, her campaign didn't rush to cancel a busy slate of events out West. The presidential candidate's husband simply stepped in to take her place.

headline.main: With His Wife Sidelined, Bill Clinton Steps In to Fill Void
headline.print_headline: With His Wife Sidelined, Bill Clinton Steps In to Fill Void

docs.snippet: Donald Trump’s presidential candidacy has triggered anguished soul searching among many college-educated and affluent Republicans who must decide whether to back him, sit out the election, or do the unthinkable: vote for his opponent, Hillar...
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump’s presidential candidacy has triggered anguished soul searching among many college-educated and affluent Republicans who must decide whether to back him, sit out the election, or do the unthinkable: vote for his opponent, Hillary Clinton.

headline.main: Trump’s Fate May Rest With Former Supporters of Arch-Critic Mitt Romney
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Fate May Rest With Former Supporters of Arch-Critic Mitt Romney

docs.snippet: A physician who treated U.S. Sen. Mark Kirk after a 2012 stroke says the Illinois Republican "has made a full cognitive recovery."...

headline.print_headline: Doctor: Sen. Kirk Made 'Full Cognitive Recovery' From Stroke

docs.snippet: The head of the Democratic National Committee said on Tuesday the organization had been hacked by Russian state-sponsored agents who were trying to influence the U.S. presidential election, after a similar leak in July roiled the party....
docs.lead_paragraph: The head of the Democratic National Committee said on Tuesday the organization had been hacked by Russian state-sponsored agents who were trying to influence the U.S. presidential election, after a similar leak in July roiled the party.

headline.main: Democratic Party Says It Was Hacked Again, Blames Russians
headline.print_headline: Democratic Party Says It Was Hacked Again, Blames Russians

docs.snippet: The head of the Democratic National Committee said on Tuesday the organization had been hacked by Russian state-sponsored agents who were trying to influence the U.S. presidential election and they may have released more documents after a similar ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The head of the Democratic National Committee said on Tuesday the organization had been hacked by Russian state-sponsored agents who were trying to influence the U.S. presidential election and they may have released more documents after a similar leak in July roiled the party.

headline.main: U.S. Democratic Party Says More Documents Leaked, Blames Russians
